answers.answer: You blood sugar is perfect. But remember, not to gain weight, if possible change you life style (quit smoking if you smoke, no alcohol, healthy balance diet with low fat, salt and carb, regular exercise)You have to decrease some extra pounds.good luck

question: I am a 43 year old male, in excellent physical shape and 5' 11"", 195 lbs.  For the past 3 years or so, I have been averaging 93 to 103 fasting blood sugar levels.  My mother and grandmother both had severe Type 2 Diabetes and unfortunately succumbed to complications from it (Heart disease) in their mid to upper 70's.  Are these levels indicative of pre-diabetes and can arterioschlerosis begin developing at these levels?  In other words, is damage beginning to occur at these levels and should I be at levels lower than the mid to upper 90's?
title: Early Diabetes?
